Package","snippet-description":"

This June, Hotel Nikko Invites you to celebrate Pride Month with a stay that's as vibrant and joyful as San Francisco itself. 

Book our exclusive Pride Package and enjoy breakfast for each guest booked, two Welcome Cocktails in Kanpai Lounge, complimentary parking for one vehicle, and a gifted copy of 49 Dogs and One Cat - The Insider's Guide to San Francisco.

  • Garage self-parking
  • Valet parking
  • Glass enclosed indoor pool
  • Pet-friendly rooms
  • Fitness center and spa services
  • Breakfast to go
  • Hotel concierge

Our hotel has worked with the SFPUC on reducing water faucet flow rates from 2.2 gpm to 1.0; and upgraded our previous 3.5 gallon per flush to 1.5 gallon per flush water closet. We partner with Ecolab, utilizing the Aquanomic laundry program, which relies on environmentally friendly low-temperature chemistry to maximize laundry efficiency. This program saves more than 150,000 gallons of water per month.

\"Green cards\" allow guests to inform the hotel of their daily laundry preferences for linens and towels.The in-house laundry program utilizes a re-use system whereby the always fresh second and third rinse cycles are saved, filtered, and re-used for first cycles.

Recipient","snippet-title":"Recycling","snippet-description":"

At Hotel Nikko, sustainability is woven into our daily operations. Excess food scraps and kitchen waste are sent offsite to be transformed into high-quality compost. We recycle paper, plastic, tin, cardboard, and aluminum throughout the property. Retired linens are donated to local shelters and charities, while torn items are repurposed as cleaning rags. Guest room keys are fully biodegradable, and recycling programs are available in every guest room and actively maintained in all meeting spaces.

Energy efficiency is a core part of our sustainability strategy. Guest room thermostats are equipped with occupancy sensors that automatically power down heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems when rooms are unoccupiedreducing unnecessary energy use. In 2015, we installed two 65kW microturbines on the hotels rooftop, creating an advanced Microturbine Cogeneration Power System. By capturing exhaust heat and converting it into thermal energy through heat exchanger technology, the system allows us to generate our own electricity and significantly reduce our carbon footprint.

","snippet-description-more":"

To further conserve energy:

  • Motion sensors in service areas automatically switch off lighting when spaces are not in use.
  • 92% of the hotels lighting has been converted to energy-saving compact fluorescent or LED bulbs, reducing both electricity use and greenhouse gas emissions.
  • Ventilation fans are fitted with Variable Frequency Drives (VFDs), adjusting energy use based on demand.
  • Our HVAC system was upgraded with two 280-ton Daikin Magnitude chillers, using sustainable R-134a refrigerant. These chillers feature frictionless, magnetic-bearing compressors for significantly improved energy efficiency. Daikon Nikko Case Study

Outreach","snippet-description":"

Giving back is part of who we are. Each year, our dedicated colleagues volunteer over 250 hours to support local community initiatives. We proudly partner with the SF SPCA, with proceeds from our childrens book, \"49 Dogs and One Cat: The Insider's Guide to San Francisco,\" and our signature Buster plush toy donated directly to support their mission.

In recognition of our commitment to community service, our hotel has been honored with the Community Service Award from the California Hotel & Lodging Association and the Community Spirit Award from the Hotel Council of San Francisco.

Our chef-curated catering menus celebrate the vibrant flavors of the Bay Area with fresh, innovative California cuisine. From energizing coffee breaks to elegant buffets and plated dinners, Hotel Nikko offers flexible food and beverage packages tailored to fit the vibe of your meetings, events, and celebrations. Menus can be customized to include vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free options for every discerning palate.

Experience a reimagined approach to business at Hotel Nikko, where intimate meeting spacesincluding our scenic rooftop deckcreate the perfect blend of productivity and social connection. Located just steps from Union Square, guests benefit from access to the soon-to-reopen UPS Store Business Center for computer rentals, printing, shipping, and translation services, along with exceptional amenities designed to inspire your next big idea in the heart of San Francisco.

Stunning Photos","snippet-description":"

Michelle Russ captured 49 dogs in more than 120 portraits in San Francisco landmarks. Alongside Buster and these famous SF sights, you'll see photos of two-time Emmy and five-time Grammy Award-nominee Michael Feinstein, all-star drag queen Heklina, and Tammy Nelson of Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon.

The exhilarating photographs of dogs in and around San Francisco is fun gift to take home and share with friends. This coffee table book is 12\" x 12\" and 187 pages of beautiful photos that capture San Francisco and Hotel Nikko's pet friendly spirit.

Protection","snippet-description":"

At Hotel Nikko, your well-being is our highest priority. Our Clean Commitment protocols are designed to ensure a safe, comfortable stayfrom enhanced cleaning and sanitization practices to contactless services and rigorous staff training. Every detail is thoughtfully managed to protect the health of our guests and team, so you can relax with confidence throughout your stay.

Start your day with the perfect fusion of California and Japanese flavors at ANZU. Nestled in the heart of San Francisco's Union Square, our serene, zen-inspired space sets the stage for an unforgettable breakfast experience. From artfully crafted morning delights to inventive twists on classic dishes, our chefs blend tradition with modern techniques to bring you something truly special. Join us for a refreshing and flavorful start to your dayreserve your table now.
